questions.question: …………………………… his poor vision, he can read books.
questions.description: In spite of is a preposition. Use it before a noun or an ing form.

questions.question: …………………………. his popularity, he failed to win the election.
questions.description: Despite is a preposition. Use it before a preposition.

questions.question: …………………………… rich he may be, he still wants more.
questions.description: However rich he may be means 'it doesn't matter how rich he is'.

questions.question: ………………………….. he grew, the more cautious he became.
questions.description: Use the comparative form in both clauses.

questions.question: The more they laughed at him, ……………………………. he became.
questions.description: Angrier is the comparative form of angry.

questions.question: …………………………… my friend saw me, he stopped the car.
……………………………. you drop the glass, it will break.
The soldiers fought with ………………………… courage that the enemy suffered a crushing defeat.
…………………………… you want more money, you have to do more work.
He is ………………………….. ill that the doctors do not expect him to recover.
She is ………………………….. shy to address a gathering.
Take a guide with you …………………………… you do not lose your way.
